articles.title: MONTHLY BULLETIN
articles.summary: This June 1971 monthly bulletin from the San Jose Amateur Astronomers lists the club's officers and includes a prominent reminder for members to pay their annual $10 dues. It details numerous membership benefits, such as a Sky & Telescope subscription, access to the club's observatory (with a 12" reflector and 6" refractor), library, and loaner telescopes, along with opportunities for star parties, guest speakers, and social events.

articles.title: MAY 22, FREE PICNIC-STAR PARTY
articles.summary: The article announces a rescheduled free picnic-star party for Saturday, May 22, at the club's observatory site. This event, previously rained out, is expected to have clear and warm weather and will offer hotdogs, soft drinks, and desserts. Attendees should arrive just before dusk, and a contact number is provided for weather updates.

articles.title: JUNE MEETING - ELECTIONS
articles.summary: The June meeting is scheduled for Friday, June 4, at 8 p.m. at Community Bank. This important meeting will feature elections, along with two "Concepts in Astronomy" seminars. Dr. Gregory will present on "The Summer Constellations," and Dave will discuss "Telescopes."

articles.title: EXPLANATION OF ELECTIONS
articles.summary: This document details the election process for board members, noting that five of nine board members are completing their two-year terms in this odd year and are nominated for re-election. Additional nominations have been put forward, and five new board members are slated to be elected at June's meeting. Following this, the full board will elect officers for the 1971-1972 term, with installation occurring at July's banquet.

articles.title: PLANNING MEETING - Friday, June 11, 8 p.m., Election of Officers
articles.summary: A planning meeting is scheduled for Friday, June 11, at 8 p.m. at Dave Ambrose's home in San Jose. The primary agenda includes the election of 1971-1972 officers, planning summer observatory activities, and organizing an upcoming public star party. All board members are encouraged to attend.

articles.title: JUNE JUNE JUNE - 3 BIG EVENTS
articles.summary: The article announces three significant events for June: a work party at the observatory on June 12, a public star party at the Skyline site on June 19 for which volunteers are sought for publicity, and the first overnight star party of the year at Fremont Peak on June 26. Attendees for the overnight event are encouraged to bring sleeping gear and telescopes.

articles.title: SEMINAR CONVENTION
articles.summary: The AIA convention is scheduled for August 24-26 in Honolulu, Hawaii, at the Princess Kaiulani Hotel. Participants are encouraged to arrive five days prior, and those interested in attending should contact Dave Erickson.

articles.title: LIBRARY
articles.summary: The club's library management will temporarily transition from Bruce Smith to Mike Szudy between approximately June 8th and July 16th. Additionally, Greg Kluhls is seeking specific back issues of Sky & Telescope from 1967 and 1969.

articles.title: PAGE 4
articles.summary: This editorial explores the ancient origins of the calendar, linking its development to early human agricultural practices. Early humans learned to associate optimal planting times with the appearance of specific stars and the sun's altitude, which led to the creation of the first calendars. This fundamental understanding also marked the birth of both agriculture and astronomy.

articles.title: SUMMER 1971 CALENDAR
articles.summary: This document outlines the Summer 1971 calendar of events for the San Jose Astronomical Association (SJAA), detailing a packed schedule from May to September. It includes various star parties (public, overnight, and a free picnic), regular club meetings, planning sessions, a work party, a yearly banquet with officer installations, and a notice about the WAA convention in Hawaii. The calendar encourages members to save it for future reference and help make it a successful summer.
